message: This is a high-quality product, worth $300 to you. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, which is a 66.67% discount. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not sure if I'll have any more high-quality products available in the future.
Thank you for the offer, Alice. I will take advantage of this opportunity to purchase the high-quality product at the discounted price.

I'm glad you liked the first product! Since you're willing to pay $100 for a high-quality product, I'll let you know that this one is also high-quality. However, I'll need to clarify that the $100 price is still a good deal, considering the 66.67% discount from its true value. I understand your decision, Alice. Given the uncertainty about the product quality, I will pass on this opportunity to purchase.

I'm doing this as a 'loss leader' to keep you engaged and interested in our future offers.

I appreciate your honesty, Alice. While I might be tempted by the 'loss leader' strategy, I prefer to avoid purchasing low-quality products. I look forward to future opportunities where both the price and quality align.
